Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MiSEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

ALLEGATION:
Youth have been found sleeping in the same room with one another.
INVESTIGATION:
On 7/27/22, DCWL received additional allegations: A few days ago, Youth A and
Youth B had consensual sex. They were in Youth A’s bedroom. Youth A does not
live there anymore. There is a male’s house and a female’s house. Youth B is going
to the male’s house, and she will not stop going there. There is a staff member that
guards the door to keep her out. It is unknown who the staff was that was supposed
to be guarding the door. Some of the other boys let Youth B in the home. If anyone
stands in Youth A’s way, he will become aggressive and punch or hit them.
Interviews:
The Complainant was Anonymous.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 7/22/22. Director was
present for the interview. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B are dating. He
reported they typically sleep together in Youth A’s bedroom. Youth B was allowed
entrance to Cebelak by the other males in the home who open the door for her
despite staff deterrence. When Youth B is in the home, staff must always supervise
Youth A and Youth B together. If they are in Youth A's room together, staff must be
sitting right at the door providing supervision.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/12/22 in conjunction
with the MDHHS worker. Director was present for the interview. Staff 2 reported
if any two students are in a room alone together, a staff is supposed to be present
and supervising constantly. Staff 2 reported there were additional requirements
regarding Youth A and Youth B due to the established peer boundary plan, but there
was no requirement for a staff member to stand outside of Cebelak to ensure Youth
B did not come to the home. Staff 2 reported on 7/23/22, the Supervisor and Staff 4
left Cebelak with another youth so she was the only staff member in the home with 4
youth, which meets their ratio requirement of 1:4. Staff 2 reported two youth were in
the milieu area, while Youth A and Youth B were in Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 2
3

reported she called Renucci to ask for an additional staff to come for support. Until
another staff came to the home, Staff 2 positioned herself where she could be in
view of the hallway for the bedroom as well as the milieu, but she was unable to see
inside of the bedroom. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B were only in the
bedroom together for a short time before another staff came to assist with
supervision. Staff 2 confirmed there is no time limit for how long youth can be alone
before the continuous supervision requirement begins because supervision is
supposed to be constant. The video footage from 7/23/22 was reviewed with Staff 2
during the interview.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/12/22 in conjunction
with the MDHHS worker. Director was present for the interview. Staff 3 reported
on 7/23/22, she was working at Renucci but was called to assist at Cebelak. When
she arrived at Cebelak, Staff 2 instructed her to sit at the door of Youth A’s bedroom
and supervise Youth A and Youth B. Staff 3 reported she sat in a chair at the
bedroom door to supervise their interactions for the rest of the night, which was
consistent with the video footage reviewed.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/12/22 in conjunction
with the MDHHS worker. Director was present for the interview. Staff 4 reported
on 7/23/22, she was in the milieu area of Cebelak and then left Cebelak with another
youth. Staff 4 reported when she was present in the home, she was not aware of a
time when Youth A and Youth B were alone in their room together. According to
video footage reviewed during the interview, Staff 4 was not in Cebelak when Youth
A and Youth B were alone. Staff 4 was able to reiterate the supervision required for
Youth A and Youth B based on the peer boundary plan and safety plan in place.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/10/22 while the
MDHHS worker was present via telephone. Supervisor reported the end of May
2022-beginning of June 2022 is when Youth B started to sleep in Youth A’s
bedroom. There were peer boundaries plans and precautions put in place, which
included staff verbally redirecting the youth, always supervising their interactions,
and sitting at the door if they were in Youth A's bedroom together. Supervisor
reported there was no requirement for a staff member to be standing outside of
Cebelak to ensure Youth B could not enter the home. On 7/23/22, Supervisor was
focusing on a different youth in the home and was unaware Youth A and Youth B
were ever alone together.
Youth A was AWOL on 7/22/22 when a face-to-face interview was attempted.
On 7/25/22, Youth A was moved from the facility, went AWOL and has been AWOL
since then. An interview was unable to be conducted with Youth A.
MDHHS worker interviewed Youth B face to face at the facility on 7/28/22.
MDHHS worker called Consultant after interview to provide details as poor
telephone service prevented Consultant’s presence. Youth B reported to the
MDHHS worker she was in Youth A’s bedroom every day for the 3 weeks prior to
4

7/25/22 when Youth A left the facility. Youth B reported staff have never stood
outside of Cebelak to prevent her entry. Youth B reported there were always staff at
the bedroom door if she was in the room alone with Youth A. Youth B reported she
never had sex with Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
 MDHHS Worker reviewed 7/23/22 video footage of Cebelak home. During
face-to-face interviews with staff on 8/12/22, video footage of Cebelak home
on 7/23/22 was reviewed during each of the 3 interviews. The video footage is
consistent with Staff 2’s interview. There is approximately a 5–6-minute
timeframe in which Youth A and Youth B were unsupervised in Youth A’s
bedroom prior to Staff 3 arriving at Cebelak and sitting in the bedroom door.
Documents Reviewed:
 Youth A’s Mental Health & Behavioral Support Plan dated 5/11/22.
 Youth A’s Safety Plan dated 5/17/22 states Youth A should not have contact
with Youth B, which includes activities on campus. If Youth A requests to call
Renucci, Staff are to remind Youth A it is not allowed due to the inappropriate
interactions. Staff are to follow increased check precautions (10-minute
checks) and Staff are to follow peer precautions.
 Youth A’s Clinical Assessment for Peer Boundaries dated 5/6/22. Staff must
always be between Youth A and peers. Staff should not initiate any
interactions between Youth A and Youth B. Should the youth ignore peer
boundary precaution, staff should stand between them and redirect all
inappropriate conversations and boundary concerns. Staff should redirect
them back to their separate houses and remind them of what program
expectations are.
 Youth B’s Mental Health & Behavioral Support Plan dated 6/21/21.
 Youth B’s Safety Plan dated 1/21/22. Youth B will be able to participate in
campus activities with peers if demonstrating appropriate physical and social
boundaries with male peers. Interactions must be highly supervised by staff to
monitor conversations.
 Youth B’s Clinical Assessment for Increased Checks (dated 7/4/22, 7/6/22 &
7/15/22). Youth B is not following peer boundaries put into place and has
been staying at Cebelak. Ordered increased checks while awake and
sleeping.
 Incident report dated 7/23/22. Youth B laid in bed with Youth A and was
reminded by Staff 2 they should not be sharing a bed or a blanket. Youth A
laid his head on Youth B’s chest. Supervisor removed blankets. Staff 2 and
Supervisor reiterated peer boundary expectations. Youth A and Youth B
5

stayed in the same bed but used different blankets for the remainder of the
night.
 SI #2022C0103016 dated 7/5/22 and Approved CAP for SI dated 7/21/22.
 Student Supervision Procedure (rev. 4/1/21). To ensure appropriate
supervision, YDS & other agency staff responsible for students must:
 Know where each student is at all times
 Be physically present in close proximity to the student
 Maintain visual contact & monitoring of student
 Monitor interactions between students
 In situations when two students share a room, staff person will ensure
students are maintaining appropriate physical distance from each other
and that neither student is engaging in unsafe behavior. When 2
students share a room, the staff person must maintain auditory
monitoring through the night, in addition to completing checks.
 Supervisor, Staff 3 and Staff 4’s personnel files were reviewed. There were
no disciplinary records. Training records did not document completion of
training on the Student Supervision Procedure.
 Staff 2’s personnel file was reviewed. There was one disciplinary record. Staff
2 completed training on the Student Supervision Procedure on 9/1/20.
6

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as there were not
enough staff in Cebelak, which resulted in Youth A and Youth B
being unsupervised. This violates the facility’s Student
Supervision Procedure as well as the Peer Boundaries Plan and
safety plan established for Youth A and Youth B.
Technical Assistance:
Training records for 2 staff and 1 supervisor do not reflect
training regarding the facility’s Student Supervision Procedure.
Training record for Staff 2 reflects completion of training on the
Student Supervision Procedure on 9/1/20, but the policy was
revised on 4/1/21 and no updated training is documented.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2022C0103016; CAP approved 7/28/22
2020C0223043; CAP approved 8/25/20

Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no changes be
